Color Contrast Checker Pro
- Single Python 3 script using only standard library (json, webbrowser, urllib.parse, os, sys).
- CLI + simple TUI using print/input with colorama-like ANSI codes from standard library for accessible terminal output.
- Core feature: Input two hex colors (foreground/background), compute WCAG contrast ratio, AA/AAA pass/fail status, suggest fixes.
- Accessibility focus: Screen reader friendly output (prefix lines with "Status:", "Result:"), high-contrast terminal colors (red=fail, green=pass), keyboard-only (all input via Enter).
- Undo/redo: Maintain history stack (up to 20 checks), 'u' undo last check, 'r' redo, 'h' history list.
- Persistence: Save/load recent checks to 'contrast_history.json' with timestamps.
- Share via URL hash: Generate shareable link format 'contrastchecker://fg=ff0000&bg=ffffff&ratio=4.5' (print for copy-paste), parse from args or input.
- Responsive grid: Terminal table output using fixed-width columns for results (Color1 | Color2 | Ratio | AA | AAA | Fix).
- Commands: 'c' check colors, 's' share last, 'l' load history, 'n' new session (clear history), 'q' quit.
- Input validation: Auto-correct hex to #RRGGBB, default black/white, error beep via print('\a').
- Testable: Run 'python contrast.py --test' prints 5 WCAG examples with expected ratios.
- Output example:
  Status: Checking #000000 on #ffffff
  Result: Ratio 21:1 PASS AA/AAA
  Grid: FG #000000 | BG #ffffff | 21:1 | ✓ | ✓ | Perfect
- Total <800 lines: Core math in 50 lines, TUI loop 200 lines, persistence/undo 150 lines.
